title: Prigozhin Forecasts Disaster if Russia Does Not Move Into Total War Footing
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin has been ramping up pressure on Russia’s military leadership and extending his criticism to the country’s moneyed elites.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: DeSantis’s Presidential Run
description: Also, China cracks down on comedy.

title: Ukrainians Were Likely Behind Kremlin Drone Attack, U.S. Officials Say
description: American spy agencies do not know exactly who carried out the attack this month, but suggest it was part of a series of covert operations orchestrated by Ukraine’s security services.

title: Why the ‘Rules’ of Politics Don’t Always Stymie Outsiders to the System
description: For decades, many voters grew accustomed to a certain set of norms that seemed to govern political systems like rules. But elite groups have lost the power they once had to enforce those norms, or decided to change their own behavior.

title: Chinese Malware Hits Systems on Guam. Is Taiwan the Real Target?
description: The code, which Microsoft said was installed by a Chinese government hacking group, set off alarms because Guam would be a centerpiece of any U.S. military response to a move against Taiwan.

title: France Bans Short Domestic Flights, But Not Much Changes
description: A decree formalizing the measure, which was passed in 2021, is riddled with exceptions. Critics call its effect symbolic, at best.

title: Rolf Harris, Disgraced British Entertainer, Dies at 93
description: His career as a musician and a painter over six decades ended abruptly when he was convicted of sexually abusing teenage girls.

title: Brain and Spine Implants Allow Paralyzed Man to Walk Naturally Again
description: In a new study, researchers describe a device that connects the intentions of a paralyzed patient to his physical movements.

title: China Ramps Up Culture Crackdown, Canceling Music and Comedy Shows
description: Performances across the country were canceled last week after Beijing began investigating a stand-up comedian.

title: Clare Nowland Dies, Australian Police Say, Hours After Announcing Charges for Officer
description: Hours before Clare Nowland died, the police announced charges against the officer who used the stun gun on her in the care facility where she lived.

title: Orcas Have Sunk 3 Boats in Southern Europe, Scientists Say
description: A small group of orcas is ramming into sailboats in waters off the Iberian Peninsula. Researchers say they do not know what is driving the unusual behavior toward boats.

title: Netanyahu Budget May Risk His Economic Legacy in Israel
description: Israel’s prime minister has long advocated a small state, free markets and benefit cuts. But his new budget is heavy on subsidies for the ultra-Orthodox community, whose political support he needs.

title: They Cuddled a Kiwi. New Zealand Said, ‘Stop That.’
description: Video of the national bird being handled by Miami zoo visitors caused an outcry in New Zealand. Even the prime minister weighed in.

title: A Year in Uvalde
description: How grief has warped the lives of the Uvalde shooting victims’ families and friends.

title: Russian Military Response Questioned After Rare Assault Inside Borders
description: An attack by anti-Kremlin fighters has come days after Moscow’s only significant battlefield victory in Ukraine in months.

title: As Protesters Die, Peru’s Security Forces Face Little Scrutiny
description: In Peru, investigations into the killing of protesters by security forces are often closed without any charges, undermining people’s faith in their government.

title: The Battle for Bakhmut Is Over. What’s Next for Russia?
description: Seizing the city took 10 months and untold lives. Most likely, analysts say, Russia’s exhausted forces will settle into a defensive crouch, preparing for Ukraine’s counteroffensive.

title: Typhoon Mawar Lashes Guam With High Winds, Knocking Out Power
description: The slow-moving Pacific cyclone brought typhoon-strength winds to the American territory on Wednesday afternoon. Most of the island was without electricity.
